responses.rationale: The segment expresses a personal feeling ('encouraged') but does not contain any of the required explicit calming keywords.
The segment describes negative facts and potential future risks, lacking explicit calming cues.
This is a bare negation ('does not present an immediate public health concern') and a bare positive fact ('no human cases'), which do not trigger Q5 according to the rules.
The segment describes past events and a prediction that did not occur, lacking explicit calming cues about the present.
The segment contains the explicit calming keyword 'safe' ('keeping you safe').
The segment discusses past budget issues and does not contain explicit calming cues.
The segment uses an intensified low-risk evaluation ('extremely rare') but does not contain any of the required explicit calming keywords.
The segment uses language to minimize the issue ('short-term blip', 'resolve itself very quickly') but does not contain any of the required explicit calming keywords.
The segment contains the explicit calming keyword 'safe' ('keep yourself safe').
The segment describes successful containment ('quickly reined in and stamped out') but does not contain any of the required explicit calming keywords.
The segment reports a positive outcome (majority spared) but lacks explicit calming language or keywords.
The segment uses language to minimize the issue ('short-term blip', 'resolve itself very quickly') but does not contain any of the required explicit calming keywords.
The segment expresses confidence in future elimination ('will be able to eliminate this') but does not contain any of the required explicit calming keywords.
The segment reports facts about a case but lacks explicit calming language or keywords.
